name: NSTrackingArea
desc: A region of a view that generates mouse-tracking and cursor-update events when the pointer is over that region.

items.name: init(rect: NSRect, options: NSTrackingArea.Options, owner: Any?, userInfo: [AnyHashable : Any]?)
items.desc: Initializes and returns an object defining a region of a view to receive mouse-tracking events, mouse-moved events, cursor-update events, or possibly all these events.

items.name: var options: NSTrackingArea.Options
items.desc: The options specified for the receiver.

items.name: var owner: AnyObject?
items.desc: The object owning the receiver, which is the recipient of mouse-tracking, mouse-movement, and cursor-update messages.

items.name: var rect: NSRect
items.desc: The rectangle defining the area encompassed by the receiver.

items.name: var userInfo: [AnyHashable : Any]?
items.desc: The dictionary containing the data associated with the receiver when it was created.

items.name: struct NSTrackingArea.Options
items.desc: The data type defined for the constants specified in the options parameter of init(rect:options:owner:userInfo:). These constants are described below; you can specify multiple constants by performing a bitwise-OR operation with them. In particular, you must supply one or more of the tracking-type constants (that is, mouseEnteredAndExited, mouseMoved, and cursorUpdate) and one of the active constants (that is, activeWhenFirstResponder, activeInKeyWindow, activeInActiveApp, and activeAlways). In addition, you may specify any of the behavior constants (that is, assumeInside, inVisibleRect, and enabledDuringMouseDrag).
